---

The goal of rovquantR is to provide user-friendly `R` and `nimble` functions to facilitate the reproduction of SCR and OPSCR analyses of the Scandinavian large carnivore monitoring data originally performed by the [Applied Quantitative Ecology Group (AQEG)](https://www.nmbu.no/en/research/groups/applied-quantitative-ecology-group-aqeg) during project [RovQuant](https://www.nmbu.no/en/projects/rovquant).

This package represents a collaborative effort between the `nimble` development team and Project RovQuant.



## Installation

You can install the development version of rovquantR from [GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

```{r, eval = FALSE, warning = FALSE, message = FALSE}
# install.packages("pak")
pak::pak("PierreDupont/rovquantR")
```


## Example

This is a basic example which shows you how to solve a common problem:

```{r example, warning = FALSE, message = FALSE}
library(rovquantR)
## basic example code
```


## Good Readme

What is special about using `README.Rmd` instead of just `README.md`? You can include R chunks like so:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

You'll still need to render `README.Rmd` regularly, to keep `README.md` up-to-date. `devtools::build_readme()` is handy for this.

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo = FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

In that case, don't forget to commit and push the resulting figure files, so they display on GitHub and CRAN.
